seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: How NWA Is Taking On The Challenge Of Urban Runoff
posts.content:
The rapid growth of Northwest Arkansas has contributed to an increased urban stormwater runoff, leading to land loss through erosion and sedimentation of water sources. 

  • Changing course: Organizations in the area have implemented 12 best management practices, such as rain gardens and porous pavements, to reduce the effects of runoff. 
  • Working together: Counties are utilizing public education, outreach, and projects to raise awareness about the runoff issue and encourage preventive measures that can be taken before erosion leads to expensive damage. 

Learn more from this short episode of Ozarks at Large HERE.

posts.title: Get A Preview Of The Aronson Lifestyle Tonight At The 112 Drive-In
posts.content:
Alamo Drafthouse is throwing a free party tonight to commemorate the transformation of the 112 Drive-In with a screening of Universal Pictures' Cocaine Bear, refreshments from Fossil Cove, T-Boys BBQ, and Meaux Beignet. Preshow begins at 4:30p and the movie at 6:30p.

  • Movie-ing on: The new development from ITEX, called The Aronson, will replace the locally-beloved 112 Drive-In with modern amenities while preserving the spirit of the iconic film destination that served NWA for 42 years.
  • Film legend: Named after cinema pioneer and Arkansas-native Max Aronson, the cinema-inspired development will include over 200 multifamily units, a retail destination, and Arkansas's first Alamo Drafthouse Cinema + Drive-In. 

Learn more about The Aronson in About You HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Ranks Among World's Best Places to Bike
posts.content:
PeopleForBikes has released its 2022 Best Places to Bike list, with Northwest Arkansas's big-four cities ranking among the world's best places for cycling.

  • Southern bike bells: Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville earned above-average ratings for their access to bike networks, as well as rankings in the top five bikeable cities for the US South region. 
  • Intentionality: Criteria for making the Best Places to Bike List include offering practical strategies to improve biking, such as youth engagement, network connectivity, and trail development.

Explore the list and view interactive maps of your city's bike networks HERE.

posts.title: Central Standard Talent Opens Its US Headquarters At Ledger
posts.content:
Central Standard Talent is excited to announce the opening of its US headquarters in Bentonville, integrating its Mexico-based operations with its new home in the Ledger Building. 

  • Tech haven: The team has been met with strong support from local and state leaders, highlighting Northwest Arkansas as an emerging leader in the tech sector. 
  • Locking in: CST offers a comprehensive solution, in conjunction with its sister company Metova, that enables clients to find and retain top talent while keeping ahead of the innovation curve. 

Read more about The Ledger's new occupant HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Restaurant Week Is Almost Over
posts.content:
Fayetteville Restaurant Week is almost over, so here are a few ideas to get the most out of this week before it ends!

  • The trifecta: Start the day with a hot scone or a corned beef sammie at The Hip Cafe, followed by a Delta Dog and a side of potato salad at Girls Gone BBQ for lunch, then settle into a three-course dinner at Mockingbird Kitchen. Sounds like the perfect food day.
  • Nightlife: Grab some friends and head out to Wine University, offering three different wines in a bottle-sized wine tower paired with a delicious charcuterie board for $30, or hit Big Box Karaoke for their $5 soba bowls!

Find more information and view participating restaurants HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Allocates $1.5M in ARPA Funds To Help With Rising Childcare Costs
posts.content:
Fayetteville is addressing the rising childcare costs by expanding its childhood assistance program with $1.5 million in ARPA funds dedicated to providing eligible recipients with up to 12 monthly payments for childcare.

  • Investing in care: The city's support for the industry is crucial to alleviating the high demand for childcare and hard-to-come-by staffing, often resulting in families being waitlisted for months.
  • Consider the cost: Childcare is often one of the most significant monthly expenses for families, impacting low-income families or those with multiple kids in childcare the most.

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: Tyson Foods & America's Car-Mart Among Top US Companies For Diversity
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas-based Tyson Foods and America's Car-Mart each made Newsweek's America's Greatest Workplaces 2023 for Diversity, a list of 1,000 companies that received top scores from employees on respecting and celebrating diversity. 

  • Employees speak up: The list was compiled after gathering data from public sources, HR professionals, and a survey of 350,000 employees from large companies. 
  • Better business: Car-Mart CEO Jeffrey Williams shared that their commitment to inclusion "allows our associates to thrive, and also for us to deliver best-in-class products and services to our customers and communities."

See Newsweek's list HERE.

posts.title: Walmart Saw Biggest Sales Month In Company History Last Year
posts.content:
Walmart's FY23 Earnings Report revealed strong sales during the holiday season, with full-year sales up 6.7% compared to the prior year. 

  • Substantial numbers: Full-year revenue came in at $611b, with adjusted earnings per share at $6.29, both exceeding expectations. December was the biggest sales month in Walmart's history, led by food sales. 
  • Realistic forecast: With increasing interest rates and a shift in sales towards more budget-friendly options, the company expects a slowdown for the coming fiscal year. 

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: New Facility Will Multiply Impact Of Samaritan Community Center
posts.content:
Samaritan Community Center has served the hurting and hungry in NWA with dignity and compassion for over two decades. In 2022, SCC served over 55,000 meals, provided over $600,000 in free dental care, and distributed 207,490 snack packs to NWA schoolchildren. 

  • New home base: The nonprofit plans to open a new 40,000 sqft facility at the corner of Pleasant Grove Rd and Hwy 71-B in Rogers, complete with a mental health counseling center, dental center, a teaching kitchen, 4-acre farm, and collaborative care center for free services and classes. 
  • The gift of growth: With 96% of funds raised for the $16.8m facility, doors should open by Sept 2023, so be on the lookout for an even more significant impact from Samaritan Community Center.

Donations are currently worth double, thanks to a challenge grant! Join the mission HERE.

posts.title: PACRIDGE Brings Regenerative Farming To Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Canadaian-based Pacific Ridge is expanding operations to Northwest Arkansas, intending to bring regenerative soil-to-shelf farming practices to more farmers, retailers, and consumers with transparency and technology. 

  • Sustainability mission: The farmer-owned company and partners with the True Crops farming community to lead transformative environmental & corporate sustainability efforts and supply quality, sustainable plant-based foods, beverages, and ingredients.
  • Branching out: The headquarters of the company's US operations will soon open in Northwest Arkansas at a facility in North Rogers, and plans to hire a group of local talent in sales, marketing, EDI, and logistics to help grow PACRIDGE's influence in the States.

Read more on PACRIDGE's expansion HERE.

posts.title: NWA Gives Offers Free Training To Help NWA Nonprofits Maximize Impact
posts.content:
With a vision to see Northwest Arkansas become one of the most generous communities on earth, NWA Gives is hosting free training to prepare nonprofits to make the most of the upcoming NWA Gives Day on Apr 6.

  • Five years strong: Since 2018, NWA Gives has helped 300 participating nonprofits raise almost $3m, enabling them to accomplish their unique missions to serve our region.
  • Training day: Register now to attend a free one-day Intensive training on Feb 21 at Thaden Field, where you can learn from the experts at Branches Mission Lab on how to effectively market, communicate and fundraise for your nonprofit.

Space is limited; sign up for the free training HERE.

posts.title: Kian Lam Kho Shares The Code To Delicious Chinese Cooking at Meiji
posts.content:
Chef Kian Lam Kho, the author of Phoenix Claws and Jade Trees, will be a guest chef at Meiji Japanese Cuisine until Feb 25 as part of Fayetteville Restaurant Week.

  • From software to food: Growing up in Singapore, Chef Kian began his career as an aerospace engineer and software developer for Wall Street before eventually transitioning to pursue food and writing. 
  • Programming flavor: Like coding a computer program, Chef Kian enjoys experimenting with recipes and ingredients to deliver a unique dish, taking liberties to make them his own while preserving the different cultures behind them. 

Learn more about Chef Kian's journey and passion on this episode of Ozarks At Large HERE.

posts.title: Get a Taste of Nostalgia During Fayetteville Restaurant Week
posts.content:
Fayetteville Restaurant Week is in full swing, and restaurants like Theo's, Southern Food Co., East Side Grill, and more are throwing it back, returning some of your favorite dishes from past menus.

  • Duck, duck, booze: Bordinos Restaurant & Wine Bar has brought back their treasured Beet-It Martini and Duck Farfalle and will be offering wine flights or by-the-glass options!
  • Double stuffed: Bottle Rocket Subs has resurrected The Stuffy with all of its sliced turkey, balsamic bacon jam, and pimento cheesy goodness! Follow that up with a sweet dessert at Andy's and get the legendary Hog Heaven Jackhammer – an exclusive treat to NWA!

Find more information and view participating restaurants HERE.

posts.title: Forbes Ranks Arvest Bank Among America's Best Employers
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas's Arvest Bank is among the 1,000 companies in the Forbes 2023 list of America's Best Large Employers.  

  • Word of mouth: The independent survey gathered responses from 45,000 American employees working within large companies, gauging their willingness to recommend their employer to friends and family.  
  • Winning streak: This is the second year in a row Arvest has been named to Forbes' list, as well as previous recognitions by Forbes, including the Best Employer for Diversity list in 2022 and World's Best Banks in 2022. 

Read the full story in Arkansas Money & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Experience the Vibrant Culture of Black-Owned Businesses in NWA
posts.content:
A vibrant display of Northwest Arkansas's businesses, food, and music will be on display this weekend during the Black-Owned Business Expo on Saturday, Feb 25, at the Fayetteville Town Center from 10-4p.

  • Face to face: The expo invites the public to interact with the businesses often featured by Black-Owned NWA, a social media company dedicated to spotlighting Black-owned businesses in NWA and the people behind them.
  • Open to the public: Admission to the expo is free, so whether you're a business owner or just a fan of goods and services, be sure to stop by, join the fun, and support local Black-owned businesses.

Follow Black-Owned NWA on Instagram for more updates HERE.

posts.title: XNA Takes Off Strong In 2023 Showing Impressive January Numbers
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas National Airport recorded 62,354 passengers in January, achieving the second-best January in the airport's history. 

  • Second to one: The only time the airport saw more boardings in January was in 2020, which boarded a total of 67,306 passengers.
  • New heights: XNA is poised for an even better Febraury and March, with new nonstop service to Phoenix and Orlando via Breeze Airways on the horizon.

Take off with FareFlightNWA for more information HERE.

posts.title: U of A School of Art Unveils Cutting-Edge Studio And Design Center
posts.content:
The University of Arkansas's School of Art has officially opened its new Studio and Design Center in the Windgate Art and Design District, made possible by over $40m in donations from the Windgate Charitable Support Foundation. 

  • Creative hub: The 154,000 sq-ft center is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities that will provide students with a wide range of creative outlets such as studio art programs, graphic design programs, and the new graduate Master of Design degree.
  • Grand opening: Stop by for a coffee at the Arsaga's Café to catch a glimpse of student-designed items from ceramics, photography, drawings, and more, and mark your calendars for the Grand Opening event to celebrate the new center on Saturday, May 6. 

Read more about the art school's new facility HERE.

posts.title: 25,000+ Thank You Northwest Arkansas!
posts.content:
NWA Daily has surpassed 25,000 subscribers! We're grateful to be part of this growing community that makes living in our unique corner of Arkansas so enjoyable!

  • Why we do it: We love calling attention to the businesses, nonprofits, artists, and culture creators that make NWA one of America's most exciting places to be, and we want everyone who lives here to feel like they can be a tourist in their own hometown!
  • Let's keep going: If you love NWA Daily and want to help us keep curating great content to keep you up to date and connected in NWA, become a Fan of NWA Daily, and you'll also gain access to exclusive giveaways!

You can also stay informed with NWA Daily through our Instagram HERE.

posts.title: Highway Improvements on the Horizon for NWA
posts.content:
Prepare yourself for slower traffic! From widening roads to replacing bridges, road crews are gearing up for several major projects across Northwest Arkansas.

  • The long haul: AR-DOT and the city of Rogers are joining forces to widen Hwy 71B between Dixieland Rd and 8th St with a 12-ft center turning lane, upgrades to several intersections, and new sidewalks. The project could take up to 6 years to complete.
  • Under the bridge: Other work this year includes improvements to Hwy 59, adding passing lanes between Sulphur Springs and Decatur, and replacing the decades-old Hwy 59 bridge that crosses the Illinois River with two new spans.

Find more information HERE.

posts.title: What Will You Whisper To The Listening Forest At Crystal Bridges?
posts.content:
Listening Forest, created by artist Rafael Lozano-Hemmer, will return to Crystal Bridges, providing another opportunity to enjoy this one-of-a-kind collision of art and technology that immerses visitors in a poetic and interactive experience with the forest.

  • Your response:  Each section of the exhibition is responsive to different interactions; for instance, add your heartbeat to an array of 3,000 lightbulbs, control giant light figures, and leave a voice recording that will join a chorus of echoes left by other forest visitors.
  • Dates and rates: The forest will be open every Wednesday-Sunday evening from Mar 1 - May 28. Prices range from $15 to $27, and kids 18 and under are free. 

Plan your visit to the Listening Forest HERE.

posts.title: Paddlesports Industry Leaders Unite In Bentonville
posts.content:
Leaders from the paddlesports industry came together in Bentonville last month to create a new national trade organization called The Paddlesports Trade Coalition. 

  • Get on board: The coalition's goal will be to expand paddlesports across North America by connecting industry leaders and addressing issues like access and sustainability.
  • Summitville: The summit was co-sponsored by the local tourism bureau Visit Bentonville and Runway Group, a holding company striving to make Northwest Arkansas a great place to live. 

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday! Whether your plans include postponed Valentine's dates or hitting the town with friends, we hope these ideas help spark some fun this weekend:

  • On stage: Get your dose of live music thanks to KUAF's list of great shows happening this weekend.
  • Eureka gras: Eureka Springs goes Mardi Gras this weekend, with a Masquerade Ball tonight, Feb 17, at 6p and a parade tomorrow, Feb 18, at 2p.
  • Mardi on: The Fayetteville Mardi Gras Parade celebrates its 30th anniversary this Saturday, Feb 18, at 2p.
  • Movie Jam: The Arkansas Black Music & Film Expo begins today, Feb 17, in Fayetteville, with multiple film screenings, followed by a day filled with music tomorrow, Feb 18.
  • At the theater: Fall in love at Walton Arts Center with Moulin Rouge: The Musical, showing multiple times this weekend.
  • Run inside: Arkansas Track hosts the Arkansas Qualifier today at 2p in the Randal Tyson Track Center. 

Have a great weekend, everyone!

posts.title: U of A Architects Receive Recognition For Outstanding Projects
posts.content:
The Architect's Newspaper showcased several projects by architects out of the University of Arkansas' Fay Jones School of Architecture and Design,

  • Rising stars: The awarded projects included The Marygrove Early Education Center in Detroit, designed by Marlon Blackwell Architects, and The ARK: Rural Botanical Garden, designed by the UA Community Design Center.
  • Going places: Somewhere Studio, the practice of UA professors Jessica Colangelo and Charles Sharpless, earned an honorable mention for its focus on public space design.

Read the full TB&P article HERE.

posts.title: Opening Weekend For Arkansas Baseball
posts.content:
No. 8 Arkansas opens the 2023 season with a big challenge this weekend, taking on three Big 12 teams in the College Baseball Showdown. 

  • Big three: Arkansas will open against the Longhorns tonight at 7p, followed by No. 15 TCU on Saturday and No. 9 Oklahoma State Sunday afternoon. 
  • On the mound: The Razorbacks have been dealt a blow with the loss of starter Jaxon Wiggins but plan on leading with Hagen Smith, Will McEntire, and Hunter Hollan this opening weekend. 

Read more on the season opener HERE.
